source.name: IDA Commitments FY2006-2011 in US Millions
source.description: IDA offers development credits, development grants, and concessional guarantees to its recipient member countries to boost economic growth, lower poverty, and improve the living conditions of their people. Given its focus on poverty, IDA directs a large share of its resources to countries where people earn less than two dollars a day. Net disbursements represent gross disbursements net of repayments and prepayments.

datasets.name: WB Chart 1

IBRD and IDA Operational Summary
datasets.description: Provides summary data on IBRD and IDA commitments, disbursements, lending and other financial indicators. The data is provided for the fiscal years 2006 - 2011.

datasets.name: IBRD: Commitments, Gross Disbursements, and Net Disbursements
datasets.description:
IBRD’s main goals are promoting sustainable economic development and reducing poverty in its developing member countries. It pursues these goals primarily by providing loans, guarantees and related technical assistance for projects and programs for economic reforms.  The majority of IBRD loans are for investment projects or programs. During FY10, the significant increase in demand was driven by the global economic crisis. 

Net disbursements represent gross disbursements net of repayments and prepayments.
